EnglishScore: All international students are required to submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting official score reports for one of the following exams: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT), IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum score of 6.0, PTE (Pearson Test of English) Academic with a minimum score of 53, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105, or ELS (English Language Services) completion of Level 112 with a grade of B or higher.

All international students must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by providing ONE of the following: TOEFL: 79 internet-based (iBT), IELTS: 6.5, ELS: Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA, Duolingo: 105, PTE: 53.

International students whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency by one of the options described in the current NKU Graduate Catalog. Accepted tests include TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (pBT), IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.5, Duolingo with a minimum score of 105, or PTE with a minimum score of 53.

All international applicants for whom English is not their native language must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by one of the following: a TOEFL score of 73 iBT (with minimum subscores of 15), IELTS score of 6.0 (with no subscore below 5.5), Duolingo English Test score of 100, ELS Language Centers completion of Level 112, or PTE Academic score of 49.

All international applicants must demonstrate a minimum level of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include TOEFL iBT 79, IELTS 6.5, PTE 58, Duolingo 110, or completion of ELS Level 112.

You must provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following:

TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) – Score of 79 (Internet Based Test), 550 (Paper Based Test), or 213 (Computer Based Test)
IELTS (International English Language Testing System) – Score of 6.0
ELS (English Language Services) – Level 112 with a grade of B or higher
Duolingo English Test - Score of 105
PTE (Pearson Test of English Academic) - Score of 55

International students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to meet the English proficiency requirement: a score of 79 or higher on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT); a score of 550 or higher on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT); a score of 6.0 or higher on the IELTS; successful completion of level 112 of the ELS Language Centers Program; a score of 105 or higher on the Duolingo English Test; or a score of 58 or higher on the PTE Academic.

Applicants must satisfy the English language proficiency requirements of the university for graduate students. This can be fulfilled by holding a bachelor's degree or higher from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a recognized institution in a country where English is an official language, or by submitting minimum official scores: TOEFL 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), IELTS 6.5, Duolingo 105, PTE Academic 53, or by completing ELS Language Center's level 112.
Program name: Post-Master of Science in Nursing Certificate

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-native English speaking countries must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (73 internet-based), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo (100), ELS Language Center (Completion of Level 112), or PTE (49).

All international graduate applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This requirement can be satisfied by submitting one of the following official test scores: TOEFL iBT score of 79, IELTS score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 53, Duolingo English Test score of 105, or completion of ELS Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA. The requirement is waived for applicants who have completed a degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a recognized university in a country where English is the official language, among other exemptions.

NKU requires one of the following for all applicants for whom English is not their native language: A score of 73 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) internet-based test (iBT); A score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 with a grade of at least a B; A score of 100 on the Duolingo English Test.
